intro: Wikstroemia foetida var. oahuensis, commonly known as the Oahu sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Oahu. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and dry, rocky soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. This variety is part of the Rutaceae family and is known for its ornamental value and ecological significance in its native habitat.
